intro: Sabatia carnosa, commonly known as the showy pinkroot, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woods and along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
